ratings.comment: Didn't like the class. Very boring lectures. Just repeated what I have already read.

Very down to earth guy. Loved this class, thought provoking. Not necessary to read but might be a good idea. Lectures and discussion are extremely helpful. Tests are the perfect amount of content, easy enough to get an A if you paid attention but not mind-numbing easy.

Jimmy is a really cool guy, but his lectures are incredibly confusing and don't follow any real outline. Essays and grades are all based on books, so grading isn't too bad despite the confusion of lectures.

Jimmy is awesome and is obviously very smart. His lectures are dry and really not intriguing but if you half pay attention you will be fine. He really cares about his students and what he is teaching. His tests and teaching methods are 100% fair even though it seems intimidating  at first. TAs matter a lot for this class.

This teacher and class are awesome!  Klausen comes off as intimidating the first couple lectures, but it is all for show to just weed out the weak.  Easy class if you attend lectures and discussion sections.  Reading isn't necessary, but recommended.

JCK is raw: tattoos, gucci shoes, emo black clothing etc. Nah but his lectures are excellent - he usually just reads the notes he has but also gets some decent discussion in, too. He acts like he's strict but he really cares about his students. Someone in our class took their own life and he held a moment of silence and cried in front of us. Real.

Didnt read the books and I got a B. Go to class, hope for a good TA, and you should be in good. Gives really good study guides, and provides interesting lectures that I could follow despite not doing the reading. Often relates concepts to something about pop culture, so that's nice. If you need 209, take it. No worries about the professor.

He's clearly brilliant - a fantastic lecturer. Takes what for many is considered dry, dense material and makes sense of it. I found the readings difficult to get through, but because of the structure of his lectures, I was able to get something out of all of the books. With this class, though, it's all about your TA. AVOID GUANGXIN FAN IF YOU CAN!

JCK is probably my favorite prof at Madison. Loved this class! He's great--really brings political theory to life. He's kind of quirky--wears almost all black, hates everything, has some really hot tattoos and a querulous personality. But Jck really knows his stuff so you will enjoy lectures and learn a lot.

very talented lecturer, clearly knows his stuff...occasionally uses a lot of big words/latin...i had a terrible TA so my experience in the class probably wasn't as good as others...2 papers, 2 exams, gives great study guides before the exams...just hope you don't get a bad TA, as they do all the grading, which is very subjective

His class is just interesting. If you attend all the lectures, then you will be okay with the exams. He gives you the preview for both midterms and finals, so don't worry about the exams too much. The papers are also managable. I engaged a lot during lecture. He makes everybody feel comfortable! I hightly recommend you guys to take class with him

JCK is one of the best professors on campus.  He makes boring historical politics come alive and interesting. Yes he can go off on tangents  in relations to the course readings, but that is his job. For someone so young, he might come across as arrogant and full of himself, but eh, why not he can walk the walk.  He has it going on! Take the class!

Lectures can sometimes be difficult to follow or too boring to stay focused on for an hour and a half, but usually they're very well-thought-out and valuable. Grading is not that difficult, just make some effort to read and/or show up to class.

Lectures are pedantic. He reads off of typed notes-- perhaps notes from a dissertation/ book he is writing?-- Nonetheless, you can understand exactly what he is trying to say because it is pre-written. He beats thematic connections to death, but the benefit is that you come away knowing exactly what is important to him.  Loved 506 reading list!
his lectures are long but interesting

He tells you that he's a jerk on the first day of class but you grow to like him a lot.  His lectures are really good at clarifying the readings of which there are a lot of.  You need to get all the notes in order to do well on the test, but if you have someone you can mouch off of then you don't have to go to class.  His tests are super hard.

Prof. Klausen is very smart and passionate about political theory. Can be a bit full of himself, but overall a good professor. I would recommend his 209 class to any poli sci major, mostly because if you attend lecture you will never have to open a book (and who wants to read Plato anyway)and still get a good grade.
A very eloquent and knowledgeable lecturer. He really knows his stuff and is able to make some really dense and dry material come across in an engaging and understandable way.

Great Prof. Seems learned beyond in his years on the material and structured lectures well as a thematic continuum. The class material was interesting but very dense and Prof. Klausen met this with eloquent and well prepared lectures. He was genuinely concerned about students understanding and took time every class to hear student ideas.

Although he came off as a jerk on the first day of class (he tells you that he's not here to entertain you), he really isn't a bad guy.  If you go to class you will learn what you need to know.  He is pretty good at explaining the ideas.  Plus he tells you what the essay and "terms to know" are for the tests.  Felt the class was very fair.

He freaks out when people don't come to class and yet refuses to make attendance mandatory.  Lectures are incomprehensible unless you've done the reading, and even then you often feel like he's talking about something completely different.  Don't feel like I've learned anything in this class other than that I apparently hate political theory.
